text: Jacques Derrida (15 July 1930 - 9 October 2004) was a French philosopher. He was born in El Biar, French Algeria into a family of Sephardi Jews.Economist obituary originally from Toledo, Spain. He developed a form of semiotic analysis known as deconstruction. His work is called post-structualism and associated with postmodern philosophy. He died of pancreatic cancer in a Paris hospital. == References == Category:1930 births Category:2004 deaths Category:20th-century French philosophers Category:Cancer deaths in France Category:Continental philosophers Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:French socialists Category:Jewish French academics Category:Jewish French scientists Category:Semioticians Category:Social democrats
title: Jacques Derrida
